posts.post_content:
Griselbrand got himself grisel-banned.  
  
What fun we had in EDH while it lasted. I shall always remember drawing half my library and winning on the spot.  
Good night, sweet prince, and may a pack of devils sing thee to thy rest.

Posted By: JonTheRed (4/28/2012 10:16:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5
posts.html:

This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5

posts.post_content:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for [Liliana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana) & [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). Spike sees a [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain) with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.   
  
So many synergies, so little time.  
  
**Block**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Standard**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Extended**: [Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) with [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze)  
**Modern**: [Goryo's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goryo's Vengeance)  
**Legacy**: [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), [Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell)  
**Vintage**: [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids), [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Dance of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of the Dead)

Rating:

posts.post_content: Whoa. Griselbrand actually makes a card like [Venser's Journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser's Journal) seem appealing. You pay 7 life to draw 7 cards, then you gain that life back plus whatever other cards you had in your hand and you don't have to discard any of them at the end of your turn? You can essentially be gaining massive card advantage and a lot more life if you play your cards right.
posts.html:

Posted By: AncientTimer (5/7/2012 4:22:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
combos with [venser's journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=venser's journal). before your upkeep, pay 7 life, gain 7 cards. upkeep- gain 7 + how many cards were already in your hand life. swing for another 7 life, spend it for 7 cards, next upkeep gain 14+life (21+ if you could afford to pay again). [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) incase you deck yourself out. [Elixir of Immortality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elixir of Immortality) in case you have to discard everything, or even [Tamiyo, the Moon Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tamiyo, the Moon Sage)'s ultimate. stock up on zombies and play [rooftop storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rooftop storm) to drop a ton of creatures all at once.  
now just to find a way to reliably cheat griselbrand out in in standard.

Posted By: Silence9 (4/30/2012 12:34:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Why can't I like this guy? The Spike in me loves him, and he really does tip the game solidly in your favor... but I am used to demons having unusual player interactions, such as [Bloodgift Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodgift Demon). Point being that flavor-wise, demons should not let you *choose* for them to use their power; they should use it whether you like it or not, and it should be up to you if that ends up working to your advantage.
posts.html:
Why can't I like this guy? The Spike in me loves him, and he really does tip the game solidly in your favor... but I am used to demons having unusual player interactions, such as Bloodgift Demon. Point being that flavor-wise, demons should not let you choose for them to use their power; they should use it whether you like it or not, and it should be up to you if that ends up working to your advantage.
